title: Beaver typeface for a hardware store
content:
Hi everyone! I have an upcoming project about creating a brand identity for a hardware store. My concept is based on a beaver and wood textures, but I’m having a lot of trouble finding a typeface to fit this design.

Can anyone suggest for me a typeface that is suitable for the logo? I was thinking a font that’s chipped or textured that reflects this nature.

If anyone can suggest another typeface or one that would fit better, that’ll be great too!

Thanks.

Vincent.
author: vtu22_2

comments.content: How about the lovely [Chase by Rian Hughes](http://web.archive.org/web/20150227021530/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=DET0000265#specimin)?

You might find [this item](http://web.archive.org/web/20150227021530/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/gnarly-dude-nf/) useful. The romance copy mentions porcupines, but it's probably equally suitable for beavers.

Your client might also like the "chiseled" lines of Emigre's elegant [Vendetta](http://web.archive.org/web/20150227021530/http:/www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=130)...

--Michael.

Chase looks great doesn't it, and Vendetta is a peach. If you should find that you are taking things a bit too seriously, this is good for a larf [http://www.dafont.com/crazy-beaver.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20150227021530/http:/www.dafont.com/crazy-beaver.font "http://www.dafont.com/crazy-beaver.font")

If you find the Chase angle interesting, Grot Wood might be worth considering.

[http://www.atomictype.co.uk/front/action.php?type\_page=fonte\_detail&choi...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150227021530/http:/www.atomictype.co.uk/front/action.php?type_page=fonte_detail&choix_id_fdy=50&id_font=260028&select_page=G "http://www.atomictype.co.uk/front/action.php?type\_page=fonte\_detail&choix\_id\_fdy=50&id\_font=260028&select\_page=G")

Wow! Those are some really nice suggestions everyone! Thanks guys! =)

I really like Chase, Grot Wood, and Vendetta cause they got a really nice design or texture to it.

Are there any fonts that look like they've been chewed i.e. bitten off maybe?? I was thinking more of a funny theme generated from the typeface.

Nonetheless, I very much appreciate your opinions and recommendations! Keep the comments rolling! =)

Vincent.
